English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, you’ve\nnever left Earth, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>은 평생 지구에만 있어 봤지?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, though space has always fascinated me.|Yes, I like it here on Earth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 우주를 늘 동경해 왔지만.|응, 나는 지구가 좋아.

English (United States)(en-US): Me too, I like Earth as well.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도, 지구가 좋아.

English (United States)(en-US): For many reasons...... but\nwhat truly captivated me was
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무수한 이유들이 있지만......\n나를 가장 매료시켰던 건

English (United States)(en-US): Earth’s kindness. Earth is benevolent,\nlovely, and very, very kind.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지구의 다정함이야. 지구는 자애롭고,\n사랑스럽고, 아주 아주 다정해.

English (United States)(en-US): When I opened my eyes, I felt the atmosphere\npierce my skin. I mistook that feeling for ‘life.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈을 뜬 순간부터 나는 대기에 살이 에이는\n감각을 느꼈었어. 그걸 ‘생의 감각’이라 착각했지.

English (United States)(en-US): It never stops being cold.\nOn the Moon, that is.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내일의 추위가 당연한 곳. 달은 그런 곳이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): But it’s different on Earth. My skin no longer\naches, and the skin-slicing cold is no more.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 지구의 공기는 달라. 더 이상 살갗이\n저리지도, 패인 듯한 시림도 느껴지지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): And yet, I’m alive.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼에도 난 계속 살아 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): And so I realized. What I felt before wasn’t\n‘life.’ It was simply the Moon’s atmosphere.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 깨달았지. 내가 처음 느꼈던 건 생의\n감각이 아니라, 달의 공기였다는 걸 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): I was merely enduring the merciless cold.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 그저 무자비한 추위를\n견디고 있던 것이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s as if Red’s flames kept you safe.|If only we could send a coat or stove to the Moon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드의 불꽃이 뭉치를 지켜 준 셈이었겠어.|달에 외투나 난로를 선물할 수 있다면 좋을 텐데.

English (United States)(en-US): On the Moon everything barely lives. The\nMoon Beings, and even the occasional moon bug.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에서는 다들 겨우 살아. 달 사람도,\n어쩌다 한 번씩 보이는 달 벌레도.

English (United States)(en-US): But on Earth\neverything blooms.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇지만 지구에서는\n모든 것이 만개해.

English (United States)(en-US): See. Earth is kind...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 봐. 지구는 다정해...

English (United States)(en-US): It could give us\nthe bare minimum
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리가 간신히 살아 있을 정도로만 대해 줘도

English (United States)(en-US): and we would still endure\nand struggle to survive,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 어쩔 수 없이 견디며\n삶을 이어 나갈 텐데,

English (United States)(en-US): but it gives us so much more.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지구는 필요 이상으로 아낌없이 주잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): Like the vast ocean and its crashing waves?|Like the soil, nurturing countless life forms?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 드넓은 바다와 찬란히 부서지는 파도?|수많은 생명의 터전이 되는 이 땅처럼?

English (United States)(en-US): The endless greenery, the rustling spring\nbreeze, the cooling rain, even the first snow.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 맞아. 펼쳐지는 녹음과 꽃, 살랑거리는\n봄바람, 대지를 식히는 소나기, 첫눈까지.

English (United States)(en-US): Changes happen everyday with a single\ngoal—to protect and nourish life.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 매 순간 변화하면서도 그 모든 것의 목적은\n생명을 지키고 키워 나가는 데에 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): Be it you or me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 너든 나든 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Earth is kind.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지구는 다정해.

English (United States)(en-US): And my Earthling friend, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 나의 지구인 친구, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Do you know how much\nyou resemble your planet?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너 역시 네가 태어난 행성을\n닮아 있단 걸 알아?

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, while reading on the concept\nof multiverses I came across a question.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, ‘다중우주’라는 신기한 개념을\n다루는 책을 읽다가 질문 하나를 맞닥뜨렸어.

English (United States)(en-US): ‘If there is a universe so remotely far away\nthat no other universe can observe it,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘아주 멀리 동떨어져 있어 어떠한\n외부 우주에서도 관측될 수 없고,

English (United States)(en-US): and zero life exists for it to be\nacknowledged from the inside,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 생명체가 없어 내부에서도\n인식될 수 없는 우주가 있다면,

English (United States)(en-US): can we say that universe exists?’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 그 우주가 존재한다고\n말할 수 있는가?’

English (United States)(en-US): It was too difficult of a question for a\nbrainless lump to comprehend at once,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뇌 없는 점액 몸이 단박에 이해하기엔\n너무 어려운 질문이었지만,

English (United States)(en-US): but my heart goes out to that\nuniverse and its eternal solitude,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 우주가 감당해야 할 억겁의\n고독이 가련하다고 생각했어.

English (United States)(en-US): with certain kinds of logic\ndenying its very existence.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 논리에겐 그의\n존재조차 부정당하며.

English (United States)(en-US): What do you think happens to stars born in\nsuch universes, far far away from our eyes?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 있잖아, 그렇게 관측되지 않는, 너머 너머\n너머의 우주에서 태어난 별들은 어떻게 되는 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): Do they truly die alone, feeling the\nterror and solitude of ‘nothingness’?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들이야말로 정녕 ‘무’의 공포와\n고독을 느끼며 홀로 죽어가게 될까?

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t know whether stars have\nthe organs necessary to feel terror,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 별들에게도 공포를 감각하는\n기관이 있을지는 모르겠지만,

English (United States)(en-US): but...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 글쎄...

English (United States)(en-US): All creatures are scared to die alone.|Surely the world can’t be that cruel.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 홀로 죽는 공포는 모든 생물의 필연이니까.|세상이 그렇게 무정하지는 않을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): But I guess no one knows for certain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 사실은 그 누구도 모르는 거겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): If we can’t ever know, what\nwould you like to think it is?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사실을 영영 모른다면, 넌 어떤\n가능성을 상상하고 싶어?

English (United States)(en-US): Well, if we’re imagining...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음, 상상의 영역이라면......

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll take my chance with the beautiful scenario.|I’ll picture the loneliest death of a star.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 아름다운 시나리오에 상상을 맡겨 볼래.|난 별의 가장 고독한 죽음을 상상할래.

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps life just hasn’t been born yet.|Even if they’re far apart, the stars have each other.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사실 아직 생명체가 태어나지 못했을 뿐이래.|외딴 우주에 살더라도, 그 별들에겐 서로가 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): The law of the universe is harsh\nbut at times warm and humorous,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우주의 섭리는 가혹하지만 때로는\n아주 다정하고 재미있어서,

English (United States)(en-US): and they fashion at least one being to gaze\nat the night sky, so that no stars are left out.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 소외되는 별이 없도록, 그들을 바라볼\n생명체를 하나씩은 꼭 빚어 내 주거든?

English (United States)(en-US): That universe... must be waiting.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 우주는... 지금 기다리는 중인 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Somewhere within, soil to tread and\noceans to breathe in are being made.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 분명 발 붙일 땅과 들이마실 바다가\n어느 행성에서 만들어지고 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): The universe is preparing to breathe\nimagination into its beings!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우주는 그곳의 생명체들에게 상상의\n힘을 불어 넣을 준비를 하고 있겠지!

English (United States)(en-US): Ones to put a story to\na star, and a name.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 별 하나에 이야기를 지어 주고,\n이름을 붙여 줄 수 있도록 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe scientific developments\nare underway?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 과학 발전의 힘을 줄 예정일 수도 있지?

English (United States)(en-US): An observatory and a telescope can snatch up\nclues about how the universe was designed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 천문대와 망원경을 만들어 우주의 조형 원리에\n대한 실마리를 낚아채도록 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): I adore the ending of this scenario!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나, 이 시나리오의 결말이\n정말 마음에 들어!

English (United States)(en-US): Whether out or in, even\nif no one recognizes them,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바깥에서든, 내부에서든. 그 어디에서도\n자신을 알아봐 주지 않아도,

English (United States)(en-US): that universe contains multiple stars\nand planets and nebulae, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 우주 안엔 수많은 별과\n행성과 성운들이 있는걸?

English (United States)(en-US): Their bond will be stronger than any other\ncelestial body. They only have each other.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들은 그 어떤 우주의 천체들보다\n끈끈할 거야. 서로에겐 서로밖에 없잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): I think those celestial bodies\nwill hold a party now and then.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 종종 천체들의 파티가 열릴 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Those close enough can hold conversations\nthrough light and gravity,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가까운 곳의 이들은 빛과\n중력으로 대화를 나누고,

English (United States)(en-US): while those far away can exchange\nmessages as gravity-penpals!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 멀리 떨어진 이들은 중력파-펜팔을\n주고받을 게 분명해!

English (United States)(en-US): I love the ending of this scenario, I really do.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나, 이 시나리오의 결말이\n정말 마음에 들어.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, some stars in some\ngalaxies of some universes
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래, 어떤 우주의 어떤\n은하계의 어떤 별들은

English (United States)(en-US): ...... must die in endless solitude.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...... 끝없는 고독 속에서 죽어 가겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): You’re right. The laws of the universe are\nirrational and harsh and merciless,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 맞아. 우주의 법칙은 사실 아주\n부조리하고 가차없고 무자비해서

English (United States)(en-US): so the stars there won’t be able\nto run from void and silence.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그곳의 별들은 공허와 침묵으로부터\n도망칠 수 없을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Only death will set them free.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 소멸되어서야 해방될 수 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Eter, nal pain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 영. 원한 고통.

English (United States)(en-US): They say nothing lasts forever, but.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 세상에 영원한 건 없다지만.

English (United States)(en-US): But in their small small world\nit must feel like an eternity.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들의 작디작은 세상에서만큼은\n영원과 같은걸.

English (United States)(en-US): ...... I don’t like the ending of this scenario.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...... 이 시나리오의 결말은\n마음에 들지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): (And now Dot has melted.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (그리고 뭉치가 녹아 버렸어.)

English (United States)(en-US): (What to do.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (이제 어쩌지.)

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, hello. You’re here.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 안녕. 왔구나.

English (United States)(en-US): I was yet again being reminded\nof the violence my black contains.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘은 나의 검정이 가진\n폭력성을 어김없이 확인당했어.

English (United States)(en-US): My body devoured a rainbow,\none reflected on the floor.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 몸이 바닥에 내려앉은\n무지개를 잡아먹고 있었거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Once touched by the black of filth,\neven a rainbow of beautiful Earth...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 폐기물의 검정은, 아름다운\n지구의 무지개마저......

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, Dot! That’s what was eating at you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저런, 뭉치야! 그런\n생각을 하고 있었구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Well, you don’t have\nto be sad. Because...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음, 하지만 슬퍼하지 않아도\n된다고 생각해. 왜냐하면......

English (United States)(en-US): that’s just science, not violence.|the colors must have burrowed into you!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 과학적 현상이지, 폭력이 아니거든.|색들은 네 품에 안겨드는 중이었을 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): In science, black is the absence of\nlight, when all color is absorbed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 과학적으로 검정은 빛의 부재.\n모든 색들이 흡수된 상태지.

English (United States)(en-US): So your black didn’t absorb the\nrainbow because it’s the wrong sort.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까 무지개를 흡수한 건 네\n검정이 ‘나쁜’ 검정이기 때문이 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s just one of its many\ntraits, so don’t worry.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검정이 가진 자연스러운 특성 중\n하나일 뿐이니까, 안심해도 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): Are you saying all shades of\nblack on Earth are like that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지구의 모든 검정들이\n전부 그렇다는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, that’s what makes them black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 그게 검정이 검정인 이유니까.

English (United States)(en-US): The black of the cat I no longer\nresent, the crow, and even the Dark?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 더는 미워하지 않게 된 흑묘의 검정,\n까마귀의 검정, 암흑의 검정 모두 마찬가지야?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, it’s the same principle.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 같은 원리지.

English (United States)(en-US): What an enormous relief. That this\nis a mere scientific phenomenon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면 천만다행이잖아.\n‘그냥’ 과학적 현상.

English (United States)(en-US): A mere phenomenon. Indeed, indeed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그냥 과학적 현상. 그럼, 그럼.

English (United States)(en-US): I feel much better. You’re certain it’s not\nthe black of dream filth rearing its ugly head?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마음이 한결 편안해. 정말 꿈 폐기물의\n검정이 패악을 부리는 게 아니었단 말이지?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, I keep telling you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 정말이라니까.

English (United States)(en-US): Light and color on Earth are shaped\nby a most miraculous system.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지구의 빛과 색은 정말 신묘한\n체계로 조형되어 있구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Thank you for sharing your\nscientific knowledge, <nickname>!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 과학적 지식을 나누어\n주어 고마워, <nickname>!

English (United States)(en-US): Now that I think, I’m sure the light was\nbeing logically absorbed into the black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다시 생각해 보니, 정말 평이하고 타당하게\n빛이 검정색에 흡수되고 있었던 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, what a relief! This isn’t\na terrible scene of slaughter!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 세상에, 다행이야! 끔찍한\n살육 현장이 아니었던 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): You said it seemed like your black\nwas ‘devouring’ light and color,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치는 검정이 빛과 색을\n‘잡아먹는’ 것 같다고 생각했지만

English (United States)(en-US): but I don’t think so. The rainbow was\nprobably snuggling in your black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 의견은 달라. 아마 무지개는 너의 검정에게\n포근하게 안겨들고 있었을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): A rainbow's day seems as if it’d\nbe full of mystery and loveliness.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무지개의 낮은 신비롭고 사랑스러워.

English (United States)(en-US): But...... don’t you think\nit might be also tiring?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만...... 한편으로는\n피곤할 것 같지 않아?

English (United States)(en-US): The world of light and color is one\naffected by refraction and reflection,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 빛과 색의 세계는 무수한\n굴절과 난반사로 인해

English (United States)(en-US): and can become extremely hot and prickly.\nYou know what that feels like, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 뜨겁고 따가워지는 공간이기도\n하거든. 뭉치도 그 따가움을 잘 알지?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, I’ve melted under the light of\nday more times than I can count!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 한낮의 햇살 아래서\n녹아내렸던 적이 수도 없지!

English (United States)(en-US): You’ve presented a black shelter to\nthe rainbow that’s longed for a break.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 휴식을 꿈꾸던 무지개에게, 넌 쉴 수\n있는 검정색 안식처를 내어 준 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): My fear of black filth
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검은 폐기물에 대한 두려움 때문에

English (United States)(en-US): almost distorted the rainbow’s\nrespite into a scene of slaughter.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무지개의 평화로운 휴식 시간을\n끔찍한 살육 현장으로 곡해할 뻔했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Thank you for your warm\npoint of view, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 따스한 시선을 건네\n주어 고마워, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Now that I think, I’m sure the\nrainbow was relaxing inside me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다시 생각해 보니, 정말 무지개가 내\n안에서 휴식하고 있었던 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): If it ever returns... I’ll be on my tiptoes.\nSo the rainbow can nap in peace!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다시 나를 찾아온다면... 그때는 조심조심 걸어 다닐래.\n무지개의 평화로운 낮잠을 지켜 줄 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, are you resting well?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 잘 휴식하고 있었어?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. I’m especially fond of this room today.\nA cradle for my myriad thoughts and feelings.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 오늘따라 이 방이 애틋해. 무수한\n생각과 마음이 태어나 고이는 요람.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, you know what?\nPaint has a peculiar quality.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 그것 알아? ‘물감’은\n참 신기한 습성을 가졌어.

English (United States)(en-US): You daub paint of varying colors on a canvas,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 도화지 위에서 서로 다른\n물감들을 치덕거리다 보면,

English (United States)(en-US): and they form patterns of chaos,\nor combine to assume rare hues.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들은 혼돈의 무늬를 이루기도, 결합되어\n묘한 색채를 띠게 되기도 하지.

English (United States)(en-US): Two things, seemingly destined to forever\nskate by each other, blend and mix.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 영영 미끄러져 지나갈 것만 같던 둘이\n마주한 채 과감히 물들거나 뒤섞인다는 사실,

English (United States)(en-US): That is precious yet strange.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...... 그 사실은 귀중하고도 기이해.

English (United States)(en-US): And is strange... yet precious.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 기이한 동시에 귀중해.

English (United States)(en-US): An obvious fact, but it feels somewhat\nnovel in your language, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 당연한 사실이지만, 뭉치의 언어를\n통해 들으니 색다르게 느껴지네.

English (United States)(en-US): Hehe. Really?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 헤헤. 정말?

English (United States)(en-US): Mm, if you ever get a chance, please sit still\nand watch paint blend with one another.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으음, 언젠가 기회가 된다면\n물감이 섞이는 걸 가만 바라봐 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): On water, on paper, on a palette... Wherever.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 물에서, 종이 위에서,\n팔레트 위에서... 어디든 좋아.

English (United States)(en-US): It resembles the stain we\nunintentionally leave each other.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 모양새는 우리가 서로에게 의도치\n않게 남기는 얼룩을 닮아 있거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Like paper towels clumped up with paint,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 덕지덕지 물감\n묻은 휴지 조각처럼

English (United States)(en-US): we are born clean and pure\nbut become filthy in time,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 백지로 태어났지만 모르는\n새에 점차 너저분해지고,

English (United States)(en-US): and end up enfolded by so many globs of\ncolor, becoming an unnameable color-blob.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 수많은 색을 덕지덕지 둘러 영영 이름도\n모를 것만 같은 색-덩어리가 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): Your canvas becomes mottled with the colors of\nall who brushed past, touched, and lingered.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 도화지는 스쳤던, 닿았던, 머물렀던\n모든 이들의 색으로 얼룩덜룩해져 가는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): ...... Brushed past, touched, lingered.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...... 스쳤던, 닿았던, 머물렀던.

English (United States)(en-US): My canvas must be mottled with every person\nthat changed me, in ways big and small.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 도화지 역시 나에게 크고 작은 영향을\n주었던 수많은 타인들로 얼룩져 있고,

English (United States)(en-US): And theirs too must be speckled\nwith drops of my paint... Right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 수많은 타인에게도 내 물감 방울의\n일부가 드문드문 묻어 있겠지?

English (United States)(en-US): ... How odd it makes me feel.|How warm it makes me feel.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 기묘한 기분이야.|마음이 따뜻해지는걸.

English (United States)(en-US): Of course. And, although very rare, when\nyou encounter those special beings
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼. 그리고 아주 드물게, 누군가의 색채로\n물들고 싶어지는 귀한 만남들이 찾아올 때

English (United States)(en-US): whose color you want to bleed into, take\nthe courage to jump into their unique color.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럴 땐 용기를 내어\n그만의 색채로 뛰어들고

English (United States)(en-US): All you have to do is readily lend them a\ncorner of your canvas for them to smear.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 기꺼이, 부벼댈 도화지\n한 켠을 내밀어 주면 될 뿐이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Like how my canvas is now colorful with\nthe colors of Earth and you, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 도화지가 <nickname>과 지구의\n색들로 잔뜩 알록달록해진 것처럼 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Yeah, your watercolor heart comes to mind.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 뭉치의 수채화 심장이 떠오르는걸.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, what kind of stain will I leave?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 난 어떤 얼룩을 남기게 될까?

English (United States)(en-US): In this space and time. And,\n<nickname>, on your canvas.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 머물던 이 시간과 공간에.\n그리고 <nickname>, 너의 도화지에.

English (United States)(en-US): ...... The stain will probably\nbe black. Or will it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 얼룩은 아마도 검은색.\n검은색이려나?

English (United States)(en-US): I’d be lying if I were\ncompletely happy about it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 온전히 기쁘다면 거짓말이겠지만.

English (United States)(en-US): But somehow a stain that’s not\nblack won’t feel like my stain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검지 않은 얼룩은 ‘나의’\n얼룩이 아닐 것만 같거든.
